comments.body: Is this for request parameter conversion?
Yes, we have Ports as []int32, but when it comes across as query params it is a []string
It would be really useful to start documenting each custom conversion that we have: https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/39865

@kargakis How would you like it documented? The intent, a reference to where it is used? We have a reverse issue that you get this behavior for free once you add it so others could rely on the conversion without realizing it.

Yes, individual PRs where custom conversions are added should at least provide a godoc explaining why the custom conversion was added. I would love to see a doc where we document all custom conversions but that's out-of-scope for this PR.
Why is this necessary? I'd like to nuke this whole file.

Smart defaulting for ListOptions deserialized from an incoming request.  Rather than make all people using it set those to empty and risk doing something wrong.

----- Original Message -----

> > @@ -28,12 +30,48 @@ import (
> >  var Codec = runtime.CodecFor(Scheme, "")
> > 
> >  func init() {
> > -   Scheme.AddDefaultingFuncs(
> 
> Why is this necessary? I'd like to nuke this whole file.
> 
> ---
> 
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub:
> https://github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/kubernetes/pull/5763/files#r27089694
`out.SelfLink = "/api/v1beta1/boundPods/" + in.ID` needs to be changed too.

I thought we had discussed this, but not in the PR, I guess.

I expected this conversion to be done as part of the conversion from the versioned API (v1beta1/2/3) pod specification to the internal pod representation in pkg/api/v1beta[123]/conversion.go rather than as part of the conversion from manifest to boundpod. If a user creates a pod without specifying the path, I want subsequent GETs to show the default value.

However, if this otherwise works, I'm happy to merge it as is. Add a TODO here and a note to #1502 that this should be fixed. Then squash the commits.
